CreatedReader.summary: A reader that waits for the physical device to acknowledge the pairing.

UpdateReaderByID.description: Update the reader object. This can be used to set a name after using this endpoint to verify the pairing code.

id.description: Unique identifier of the API Key.

name.description: User-assigned name of the API Key.

plaintext.description: The plaintext value of the API key. This field is returned only in the response to API key creation and is never again available in the plaintext form.

preview.description: Last 8 characters of the API key.

country.description: Two letter country code formatted according to [ISO3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2).

line1.description: First line of the address with details of the street name and number.

line2.description: Second line of the address with details of the building, unit, apartment, and floor numbers.

state.description: State name or abbreviation from the address.

Affiliate.description:
Affiliate metadata for the transaction.
It is an optional field that allow for integrators to track the source of the transaction.

app_id.description:
Application ID of the affiliate.
It is a unique identifier for the application and should be set by the integrator in the [Affiliate Keys](https://developer.sumup.com/affiliate-keys) page.

foreign_transaction_id.description:
Foreign transaction ID of the affiliate.
It is a unique identifier for the transaction.
It can be used later to fetch the transaction details via the [Transactions API](https://developer.sumup.com/api/transactions/get).

key.description:
Key of the affiliate.
It is a unique identifier for the key  and should be generated by the integrator in the [Affiliate Keys](https://developer.sumup.com/affiliate-keys) page.

tags.description:
Additional metadata for the transaction.
It is key-value object that can be associated with the transaction.

Attributes.description: Object attributes that modifiable only by SumUp applications.

client_id.description: The client ID of your application that was generated when you [registered it](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/register-app).

client_secret.description: The client secret of your application that was generated when you [registered it](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/register-app).

code.description: The authorization code that you received from requesting an authorization code.

grant_type.description: The grant type used for obtaining an access token.

refresh_token.description: A **required** parameter when generating a refresh token.

created_at.description: Creation date of the bank account

primary.description: The primary bank account is the one used for payouts

last_name.description: BO's last name of the user

Card.description: __Required when payment type is `card`.__ Details of the payment card.

cvv.description: Three or four-digit card verification value (security code) of the payment card.

expiry_month.description: Month from the expiration time of the payment card. Accepted format is `MM`.

expiry_year.description: Year from the expiration time of the payment card. Accepted formats are `YY` and `YYYY`.

last_4_digits.description: Last 4 digits of the payment card number.

name.description: Name of the cardholder as it appears on the payment card.

number.description: Number of the payment card (without spaces).

type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card.

zip_code.description: Required five-digit ZIP code. Applicable only to merchant users in the USA.

last_4_digits.description: Last 4 digits of the payment card number.

type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card.

checkout_reference.description: Unique ID of the payment checkout specified by the client application when creating the checkout resource.

customer_id.description: Unique identification of a customer. If specified, the checkout session and payment instrument are associated with the referenced customer.

date.description: Date and time of the creation of the payment checkout. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

description.description: Short description of the checkout visible in the SumUp dashboard. The description can contribute to reporting, allowing easier identification of a checkout.

id.description: Unique ID of the checkout resource.

merchant_code.description: Unique identifying code of the merchant profile.

pay_to_email.description: Email address of the registered user (merchant) to whom the payment is made.

return_url.description: URL to which the SumUp platform sends the processing status of the payment checkout.

transactions.description: List of transactions related to the payment.

valid_until.description: Date and time of the checkout expiration before which the client application needs to send a processing request. If no value is present, the checkout does not have an expiration time.

checkout_reference.description: Unique ID of the payment checkout specified by the client application when creating the checkout resource.

customer_id.description: Unique identification of a customer. If specified, the checkout session and payment instrument are associated with the referenced customer.

date.description: Date and time of the creation of the payment checkout. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

description.description: Short description of the checkout visible in the SumUp dashboard. The description can contribute to reporting, allowing easier identification of a checkout.

id.description: Unique ID of the checkout resource.

merchant_code.description: Unique identifying code of the merchant profile.

pay_to_email.description: Email address of the registered user (merchant) to whom the payment is made. It is highly recommended to use `merchant_code` instead of `pay_to_email`.

personal_details.description: Object containing personal details about the payer, typical for __Boleto__ checkouts

postal_code.description: Payer's postal code. Must be eight digits long, however an optional dash could be applied after the 5th digit ([more information about the format available here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_postal_codes_in_Brazil)). Both options are accepted as correct.

redirect_url.description: __Required__ for [APMs](https://developer.sumup.com/online-payments/apm/introduction) and __recommended__ for card payments. Refers to a url where the end user is redirected once the payment processing completes. If not specified, the [Payment Widget](https://developer.sumup.com/online-payments/tools/card-widget) renders [3DS challenge](https://developer.sumup.com/online-payments/features/3ds) within an iframe instead of performing a full-page redirect.

return_url.description: URL to which the SumUp platform sends the processing status of the payment checkout.

transactions.description: List of transactions related to the payment.

valid_until.description: Date and time of the checkout expiration before which the client application needs to send a processing request. If no value is present, the checkout does not have an expiration time.

CheckoutProcessMixin.description: Details of the payment instrument for processing the checkout.

customer_id.description: __Required when `token` is provided.__ Unique ID of the customer.

installments.description: Number of installments for deferred payments. Available only to merchant users in Brazil.

token.description: __Required when using a tokenized card to process a checkout.__ Unique token identifying the saved payment card for a customer.

payment_instrument.description: Object containing token information for the specified payment instrument

redirect_url.description: Refers to a url where the end user is redirected once the payment processing completes.

transaction_code.description: Transaction code of the successful transaction with which the payment for the checkout is completed.

transaction_id.description: Transaction ID of the successful transaction with which the payment for the checkout is completed.

card_type.description:
The card type of the card used for the transaction.
Is is required only for some countries (e.g: Brazil).

description.description: Description of the checkout to be shown in the Merchant Sales

installments.description:
Number of installments for the transaction.
It may vary according to the merchant country.
For example, in Brazil, the maximum number of installments is 12.

return_url.description:
Webhook URL to which the payment result will be sent.
It must be a HTTPS url.

tip_rates.description:
List of tipping rates to be displayed to the cardholder.
The rates are in percentage and should be between 0.01 and 0.99.
The list should be sorted in ascending order.

CreateReaderCheckoutAmount.description:
Amount of the transaction.
The amount is represented as an integer value altogether with the currency and the minor unit.
For example, EUR 1.00 is represented as value 100 with minor unit of 2.

minor_unit.description:
The minor units of the currency. It represents the number of decimals of the currency.
For the currencies CLP, COP and HUF, the minor unit is 0.

value.description:
Total amount of the transaction.
It must be a positive integer.

Currency.description: Three-letter [ISO4217](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) code of the currency for the amount. Currently supported currency values are enumerated above.

company_registration_number.description: Doing business as company registration number

param.description: Parameter name (with relative location) to which the error applies. Parameters from embedded resources are displayed using dot notation. For example, `card.name` refers to the `name` parameter embedded in the `card` object.

status_code.description: HTTP status code for the error.

deducted_fee_amount.description: Amount of the fee deducted for the event.

fee_amount.description: Amount of the fee related to the event.

EventID.description: Unique ID of the transaction event.

HorizontalAccuracy.description: Indication of the precision of the geographical position received from the payment terminal.

email.description: Email address of the invited user.

Lat.description: Latitude value from the coordinates of the payment location (as received from the payment terminal reader).

LegalType.description: Id of the legal type of the merchant profile

sole_trader.description: Sole trader legal type if true

Link.description: Details of a link to a related resource.

href.description: URL for accessing the related resource.

rel.description: Specifies the relation to the current resource.

type.description: Specifies the media type of the related resource.

max_amount.description: Maximum allowed amount for the refund.

min_amount.description: Minimum allowed amount for the refund.

Lon.description: Longitude value from the coordinates of the payment location (as received from the payment terminal reader).

MandatePayload.description: Mandate is passed when a card is to be tokenized

example.user_agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/88.0.4324.104 Safari/537.36

user_agent.description: Operating system and web client used by the end-user

user_ip.description: IP address of the end user. Supports IPv4 and IPv6

merchant_code.description: Merchant code which has the mandate

Member.description: A member is user within specific resource identified by resource id, resource type, and associated roles.
Member.title: Member

disabled_at.description: Time when the user has been disabled. Applies only to virtual users (`virtual_user: true`).

email.description: End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax. The RP MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique, for unique identification use ID instead.

id.description: Identifier for the End-User (also called Subject).

mfa_on_login_enabled.description: True if the user has enabled MFA on login.

nickname.description: User's preferred name. Used for display purposes only.

picture.description: URL of the End-User's profile picture. This URL refers to an image file (for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file), rather than to a Web page containing an image.

virtual_user.description: True if the user is a virtual user (operator).

is_migrated_payleven_br.description: Merchant comes from payleven BR migration

country.description: Merchant country code formatted according to [ISO3166-1 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) (for internal usage only)

extdev.description: True if the merchant is extdev

merchant_code.description: Unique identifying code of the merchant profile

nature_and_purpose.description: Nature and purpose of the business

payout_zone_migrated.description: True if the payout zone of this merchant is migrated

daily_payout_email.description: Whether merchant will receive daily payout emails

gross_settlement.description: Whether merchant has gross settlement enabled

monthly_payout_email.description: Whether merchant will receive monthly payout emails

moto_payment.description: Whether merchant can make MOTO payments

payout_on_demand.description: Whether merchant will receive payouts on demand

payout_on_demand_available.description: Whether merchant can edit payouts on demand

printers_enabled.description: Whether to show printers in mobile app

tax_enabled.description: Whether to show tax in receipts (saved per transaction)

Meta.description: Set of user-defined key-value pairs attached to the object.

Metadata.description: Set of user-defined key-value pairs attached to the object. Partial updates are not supported. When updating, always submit whole metadata.

active.description: Indicates whether the payment instrument is active and can be used for payments. To deactivate it, send a `DELETE` request to the resource endpoint.

last_4_digits.description: Last 4 digits of the payment card number.

type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card.

created_at.description: Creation date of payment instrument. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

token.description: Unique token identifying the saved payment card for a customer.

full_transaction_history_view.description: Can view full merchant transaction history

birthdate.description: Date of birth of the customer.

Product.description: Details of the product for which the payment is made.

name.description: Name of the product from the merchant's catalog.

price.description: Price of the product without VAT.

price_with_vat.description: Price of a single product item with VAT.

quantity.description: Number of product items for the purchase.

single_vat_amount.description: Amount of the VAT for a single product item (calculated as the product of `price` and `vat_rate`, i.e. `single_vat_amount = price * vat_rate`).

total_price.description: Total price of the product items without VAT (calculated as the product of `price` and `quantity`, i.e. `total_price = price * quantity`).

total_with_vat.description: Total price of the product items including VAT (calculated as the product of `price_with_vat` and `quantity`, i.e. `total_with_vat = price_with_vat * quantity`).

vat_amount.description: Total VAT amount for the purchase (calculated as the product of `single_vat_amount` and `quantity`, i.e. `vat_amount = single_vat_amount * quantity`).

vat_rate.description: VAT rate applicable to the product.

Reader.description: A physical card reader device that can accept in-person payments.
Reader.title: Reader

ReaderCheckoutStatusChange.description: The callback payload containing the status change of the Reader Checkout.

client_transaction_id.description: The unique client transaction id. It is the same returned by the Checkout.

merchant_code.description: The target merchant code owner of the transaction.

ReaderDevice.description: Information about the underlying physical device.

identifier.description: A unique identifier of the physical device (e.g. serial number).

model.description: Identifier of the model of the device.

ReaderID.description:
Unique identifier of the object.

Note that this identifies the instance of the physical devices pairing with your SumUp account. 

If you DELETE a reader, and pair the device again, the ID will be different. Do not use this ID to refer to a physical device.

ReaderName.description: Custom human-readable, user-defined name for easier identification of the reader.

ReaderPairingCode.description:
The pairing code is a 8 or 9 character alphanumeric string that is displayed on a SumUp Device after initiating the pairing.
It is used to link the physical device to the created pairing.

ReaderStatus.description:
The status of the reader object gives information about the current state of the reader.

Possible values:

- `unknown` - The reader status is unknown.
- `processing` - The reader is created and waits for the physical device to confirm the pairing.
- `paired` - The reader is paired with a merchant account and can be used with SumUp APIs.
- `expired` - The pairing is expired and no longer usable with the account. The resource needs to get recreated

TimestampEvent.description: Date and time of the transaction event.

date.description: Date when the transaction event occurred.

due_date.description: Date when the transaction event is due to occur.

installment_number.description: Consecutive number of the installment that is paid. Applicable only payout events, i.e. `event_type = PAYOUT`.

events.description: List of events related to the transaction.

links.description: List of hyperlinks for accessing related resources.

local_time.description: Local date and time of the creation of the transaction.

location.description: Details of the payment location as received from the payment terminal.

products.description: List of products from the merchant's catalogue for which the transaction serves as a payment.

simple_payment_type.description: Simple name of the payment type.

simple_status.description: Status generated from the processing status and the latest transaction state.

tax_enabled.description: Indicates whether tax deduction is enabled for the transaction.

transaction_events.description: List of transaction events related to the transaction.

username.description: Email address of the registered user (merchant) to whom the payment is made.

vat_rates.description: List of VAT rates applicable to the transaction.

verification_method.description: Verification method used for the transaction.

card_type.description: Issuing card network of the payment card used for the transaction.

type.description: Type of the transaction for the registered user specified in the `user` property.

user.description: Email address of the registered user (merchant) to whom the payment is made.

installments_count.description: Current number of the installment for deferred payments.

payment_type.description: Payment type used for the transaction.

timestamp.description: Date and time of the creation of the transaction. Response format expressed according to [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) code.

transaction_code.description: Transaction code returned by the acquirer/processing entity after processing the transaction.

auth_code.description: Authorization code for the transaction sent by the payment card issuer or bank. Applicable only to card payments.

entry_mode.description: Entry mode of the payment details.

internal_id.description: Internal unique ID of the transaction on the SumUp platform.

merchant_code.description: Unique code of the registered merchant to whom the payment is made.

tip_amount.description: Amount of the tip (out of the total transaction amount).

vat_amount.description: Amount of the applicable VAT (out of the total transaction amount).

payout_plan.description: Payout plan of the registered user at the time when the transaction was made.

payouts_received.description: Number of payouts that are made to the registered user specified in the `user` property.

payouts_total.description: Total number of payouts to the registered user specified in the `user` property.

product_summary.description: Short description of the payment. The value is taken from the `description` property of the related checkout resource.

accessToken.description:
At SumUp authentication uses your API credentials and Basic HTTP auth. The API credentials consist of a `client_id` and `client_secret` key-value pair.

It is possible to create multiple API credentials for each of the applications you connect with your SumUp Profile.

Use the API credentials as an authorization header for requests that require such.

Authorization
---------

SumUp uses the [OAuth 2.0 authorization framework](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) and supports [two authorization flows](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/authorization/#authorization-flows) for [obtaining an access token](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/register-app/#3-create-oauth-client-credentials).

The flow you choose will grant your access token-specific permissions. All API calls should include the obtained access token in the `Authorization: Bearer <<valid_access_token>>` format.

To complete successful requests, ensure you have requested the [necessary scopes](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/authorization/#authorization-scopes) for your authorization flow of choice.

scopes.payment_instruments: Manage customers and their payment instruments.
scopes.payments: Make payments by creating and processing checkouts.
scopes.user.app-settings: View and manage the SumUp mobile application settings.
scopes.user.payout-settings: View and manage your payout settings.
scopes.user.profile: View and manage your user profile.
scopes.user.subaccounts: View and manage the user profile details of your employees.

scopes.payment_instruments: Manage customers and their payment instruments.
scopes.payments: Make payments by creating and processing checkouts.
scopes.user.app-settings: View and manage the SumUp mobile application settings.
scopes.user.payout-settings: View and manage your payout settings.
scopes.user.profile: View and manage your user profile.
scopes.user.subaccounts: View and manage the user profile details of your employee.

info.description:
SumUps REST API operates with `application/json` HTTP requests and response. The request bodies are sent through resource-oriented URLs and use the standard HTTP response codes.
For testing our APIs make sure you have a SumUp Profile (you can create one [here](https://me.sumup.com)). To activate your SumUp Profile [follow these steps](https://help.sumup.com/en-GB/articles/7gSOGSm2wEwIHyAvjitrLF).

Once you have an active SumUp Profile, go to [developer.sumup.com](https://developer.sumup.com/) and click on Create On the top right side, click on Profile followed by Test profiles Select your business country Click Create Copy and store safely the user name (format: 32 characters@developers.sumup.com) and randomly generated unique password.

Note: You will not be able to access your password afterwards make sure to store it safely before dismissing the message

Note: SumUp merchants are able to create up to 20 test profiles

When you receive your test profile you can create your [client credentials](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/register-app/#3-create-oauth-client-credentials) and process different requests with real payment instruments, without charging them.
Legal note: We reserve the right to change, modify, or remove the contents of this Website and SumUp APIs at any time without notice.
info.title: SumUp REST API

get.description: Request authorization from users and grant your application access to resources associated with the user's profile.

parameters.description: The type of the expected response. The value must be `code` to indicate that you expect to receive an authorization code.
parameters.name: response_type

parameters.description: The client ID of your application that was generated when you [registered it](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/register-app/).
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: The URI to which the merchant user is redirected after authorizing your application to access their user's profile data and to which the authorization code is sent. The value must match exactly one of the [registered URIs](https://developer.sumup.com/docs/register-app#3-create-oauth-client-credentials) for your application.
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: A space-separated list of scopes for which you request authorization. If you don't specify any scopes in the request, your application will be granted authorization for the default scopes.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: A unique local state that can be used for correlating requests and responses and for preventing [cross-site request forgery](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-10.12).
parameters.name: state

post.description: Generate a token or a refresh token

refresh_token.description: Successfully created access token with the refresh token

access_token.description: The access token that you need to use in your requests to the SumUp API.

expires_in.description: The validity of the access token in seconds.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token provided in the request call

scope.description: List of authorization scopes granted to your access token.

token_type.description: The type of the token. The value is always `Bearer`.

Invalid_Parameter.description: A parameter is invalid or expired.

Missing_Parameter.description: A parameter is missing in the request.

get.description: Lists created checkout resources according to the applied `checkout_reference`.

post.description:
Creates a new payment checkout resource. The unique `checkout_reference` created by this request, is used for further manipulation of the checkout.

For 3DS checkouts, add the `redirect_url` parameter to your request body schema.

Follow by processing a checkout to charge the provided payment instrument.

Processing a checkout will attempt to charge the provided payment instrument for the amount of the specified checkout resource initiated in the `Create a checkout` endpoint.

Follow this request with `Retrieve a checkout` to confirm its status.

parameters.description: Unique ID of the transaction.

post.description: Refunds an identified transaction either in full or partially.

schema.description: Optional amount for partial refunds of transactions.

amount.description: Amount to be refunded. Eligible amount can't exceed the amount of the transaction and varies based on country and currency. If you do not specify a value, the system performs a full refund of the transaction.

Not_Found.description: The identified resource is not found on the server.

Transaction_Not_Refundable.description: The state of the identified transaction resource does not permit the requested operation.

value.message: The transaction is not refundable in its current state

get.description:
Retrieves the full details of an identified transaction. The transaction resource is identified by a query parameter and *one* of following parameters is required:
 *  `id`
 *  `internal_id`
 *  `transaction_code`
 *  `foreign_transaction_id`
 *  `client_transaction_id`

parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction ID (the `id` parameter in the transaction resource).
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified internal transaction ID (the `internal_id` parameter in the transaction resource).
parameters.name: internal_id

parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction code.
parameters.name: transaction_code

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

Not_Found.description: The identified resource is not found on the server.

get.description: Lists detailed history of all transactions associated with the merchant profile.

parameters.description: Retrieves the transaction resource with the specified transaction code.
parameters.name: transaction_code

parameters.description: Specifies the order in which the returned results are displayed.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of results per page. Value must be a positive integer and if not specified, will return 10 results.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Filters the returned results by user email.
parameters.name: users

parameters.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of final statuses of the transactions.
parameters.name: statuses

parameters.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of payment types used for the transactions.
parameters.name: payment_types

parameters.description: Filters the returned results by the specified list of transaction types.
parameters.name: types

parameters.description: Filters the results by the latest modification time of resources and returns only transactions that are modified *at or after* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).
parameters.name: changes_since

parameters.description: Filters the results by the creation time of resources and returns only transactions that are created *before* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).
parameters.name: newest_time

parameters.description: Filters the results by the reference ID of transaction events and returns only transactions with events whose IDs are *smaller* than the specified value. This parameters supersedes the `newest_time` parameter (if both are provided in the request).
parameters.name: newest_ref

parameters.description: Filters the results by the creation time of resources and returns only transactions that are created *at or after* the specified timestamp (in [ISO8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format).
parameters.name: oldest_time

parameters.description: Filters the results by the reference ID of transaction events and returns only transactions with events whose IDs are *greater* than the specified value. This parameters supersedes the `oldest_time` parameter (if both are provided in the request).
parameters.name: oldest_ref

get.description: Lists merchant members with their roles and permissions.

parameters.description: Offset of the first member to return.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Maximum number of member to return.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Indicates to skip count query.
parameters.name: scroll

parameters.description: Filter the returned users by email address prefix.
parameters.name: email

parameters.description: Filter the returned members by the membership status.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Filter the returned users by role.
parameters.name: roles

email.description: Email address of the member to add.

is_managed_user.description: True if the user is managed by the merchant. In this case, we'll created a virtual user with the provided password and nickname.

nickname.description: Nickname of the member to add. Only used if `is_managed_user` is true. Used for display purposes only.

password.description: Password of the member to add. Only used if `is_managed_user` is true.

roles.description: List of roles to assign to the new member.

429.description: Too many invitations sent to that user. The limit is 10 requests per 5 minutes and the Retry-After header is set to the number of minutes until the reset of the limit.

get.description: Returns merchant member details.

put.description: Update assigned roles of the member.

user.description: Allows you to update user data of managed users.

nickname.description: User's preferred name. Used for display purposes only.

password.description: Password of the member to add. Only used if `is_managed_user` is true.

400.description: Cannot set password or nickname for an invited user.

403.description: Cannot change password for managed user. Password was already used before.

409.description: Cannot update member as some data conflict with existing members.

parameters.name: merchant_code

parameters.description: The amount for which the payment methods should be eligible, in major units. Note that currency must also be provided when filtering by amount.
parameters.name: amount

parameters.description: The currency for which the payment methods should be eligible.
parameters.name: currency

id.description: The ID of the payment method.

Invalid_Parameter.description: One or more of the parameters are invalid.

failed_constraints.message: Currency must also be specified when filtering by amount

Not_Authorized_Token.description: The access token is valid but the application is not authorized.

get.description: Returns list of all readers of the merchant.

post.description: Create a new reader linked to the merchant account.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.
parameters.name: id

200.description: The reader got successfully deleted from the merchant account.

get.description: Gets a Reader.

parameters.description:
Return the reader only if it has been modified after the specified timestamp given in the headers.

Timestamps are accepted in the following formats:
 - HTTP Standard: [IMF format (RFC 5322)](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc5322#section-3.3), sometimes also referred to as [RFC 7231](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.1).
 - RFC 3339: Used for timestamps in JSON payloads on this API.
parameters.name: If-Modified-Since

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.
parameters.name: id

404.description: The requested Reader resource does not exists.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.
parameters.name: id

304.description: The update request was successful, but the reader didn't get updated.

403.description: The reader is not linked to the merchant account.

200.description:
Your server returns this code if it accepts the callback.
If the server returns any other code, the callback will be retried up to 5 times with exponential backoff.

post.description:
Create a Checkout for a Reader.

This process is asynchronous and the actual transaction may take some time to be stared on the device.


There are some caveats when using this endpoint:
* The target device must be online, otherwise checkout won't be accepted
* After the checkout is accepted, the system has 60 seconds to start the payment on the target device. During this time, any other checkout for the same device will be rejected.

**Note**: If the target device is a Solo, it must be in version 3.3.24.3 or higher.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.
parameters.name: id

client_transaction_id.description:
The client transaction ID is a unique identifier for the transaction that is generated for the client.
It can be used later to fetch the transaction details via the [Transactions API](https://developer.sumup.com/api/transactions/get).

201.description: The Checkout got successfully created for the given reader.

DataValidation.description: Validation errors for the informed fields.

ReaderCheckoutPending.description: Error returned when a checkout was requested in the last 60 seconds.

errors.detail: A pending transaction already exists for this device

ReaderOffline.description: Error returned when the target device is not online.

post.description:
Create a Terminate action for a Reader.

It stops the current transaction on the target device.

This process is asynchronous and the actual termination may take some time to be performed on the device.


There are some caveats when using this endpoint:
* The target device must be online, otherwise terminate won't be accepted
* The action will succeed only if the device is waiting for cardholder action: e.g: waiting for card, waiting for PIN, etc.
* There is no confirmation of the termination.

If a transaction is successfully terminated and `return_url` was provided on Checkout, the transaction status will be sent as `failed` to the provided URL.

**Note**: If the target device is a Solo, it must be in version 3.3.28.0 or higher.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the reader.
parameters.name: id

202.description: The Terminate action was successfully dispatched for the given reader.

ReaderOffline.description: Error returned when the target device is not online.

tags.description:
SumUp API uses [API keys](/online-payments/introduction/authorization#api-keys) for authentication.
You can view and manage your API keys in the [API Keys](/api-keys) section of the [Developer Portal](/).


API keys are short static tokens that are passed in the `Authorization` header to authenticate the requests.


The tokens have a `sup_sk_` prefix. Your API keys have access to the whole SumUp API, so make sure to keep them secure.


All requests must be made over [HTTPS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTPS) and must be authenticated.


Alternatively, SumUp APIs support [OAuth2](/online-payments/introduction/authorization#oauth-20) authentication for applications that want to use SumUp as a platform for other users.


Read more about authorization in our [Authorization guide](/online-payments/introduction/authorization).
tags.name: Authorization

tags.description:
Accept payments from your end users by adding the Checkouts model to your platform.
SumUp supports standard and single payment 3DS checkout flows.

The Checkout model allows creating, listing, retrieving, processing and deactivating checkouts.
A payment is completed by creating a checkout and then processing the checkout.
tags.name: Checkouts

tags.description:
Allow your regular customers to save their information with the Customers model.
This will prevent re-entering payment instrument information for recurring payments on your platform.

Depending on the needs you can allow, creating, listing or deactivating payment instruments & creating, retrieving and updating customers.
tags.name: Customers

tags.description:
Retrieve details for a specific transaction by its `id`
or any other required query parameter, or list all transactions related to the merchant account.
tags.name: Transactions

tags.description:
The Payouts model will allow you to track funds youve received from SumUp.
You can receive a detailed payouts list with information like dates, fees, references and statuses, using the `List payouts` endpoint.
tags.name: Payouts

tags.description: The Receipts model obtains receipt-like details for specific transactions.
tags.name: Receipts

tags.description:
API Keys allow your application to gain programmatic access to SumUp.
API Keys allow application to do authorized requests within the SumUp ecosystem. API Keys are scopes to single account and thus can't be used for endpoints where user presence is needed (for such endpoints it is necessary to use OAuth2).
tags.name: API Keys

tags.description: Endpoints to manage account members. Members are users that have membership within merchant accounts.
tags.name: Members

tags.description: A reader represents a device that accepts payments. You can use the SumUp Solo to accept in-person payments.
tags.name: Readers
